title: Provides that physician fee reimbursement under the Medicaid program for office visits be no less than the amount reimbursed for hospital out-patient settings
summary: Provides that physician fee reimbursement under the Medicaid program for office visits be no less than the amount reimbursed for physician treatment in hospital out-patient settings.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2035

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the social services law, in relation  to  physician  fee
         reimbursements  under  the medical assistance for needy persons (medi-
         caid) program

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Paragraph  (a)  of  subdivision 1 of section 367-a of the
    2  social services law, as amended by chapter 165 of the laws of  1991,  is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    (a)  Any  inconsistent provision of this chapter or other law notwith-
    5  standing, no assignment of the claim of any supplier of medical  assist-
    6  ance shall be valid and enforceable as against any LOCAL social services
    7  district  or  the    STATE  department  OF  HEALTH, and any payment with
    8  respect to any medical assistance shall be made to the person,  institu-
    9  tion,  state department or agency or municipality supplying such medical
   10  assistance at rates established by the appropriate LOCAL social services
   11  district and contained in its approved local  medical  plan,  except  as
   12  otherwise   permitted  or  required  by  applicable  federal  and  state
   13  provisions, including the regulations of the STATE department OF HEALTH;
   14  provided, however, that for those districts for whom the  STATE  depart-
   15  ment  OF HEALTH has assumed payment responsibilities pursuant to section
   16  three hundred sixty-seven-b of this  [chapter]  TITLE,  rates  shall  be
   17  established  by  the  STATE  department  OF  HEALTH, except as otherwise
   18  required by applicable provisions of federal or state law; AND  PROVIDED
   19  FURTHER,  HOWEVER,  THAT  AMOUNTS  PAYABLE  UNDER THIS TITLE FOR MEDICAL
   20  ASSISTANCE FOR SERVICES PROVIDED BY PHYSICIANS IN THEIR OFFICES SHALL BE
   21  NO LESS THAN THE AMOUNTS PAYABLE UNDER THIS TITLE FOR MEDICAL ASSISTANCE
   22  FOR SERVICES PROVIDED BY PHYSICIANS IN OUT-PATIENT DEPARTMENTS OF HOSPI-
   23  TALS LOCATED IN THE SAME LOCAL SOCIAL SERVICES DISTRICT AS  SUCH  PHYSI-
   24  CIAN'S  OFFICE IS LOCATED. A LOCAL social services official may apply to

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06816-01-1

       S. 2035                             2

    1  the STATE department OF HEALTH for  local  variations  in  rates  to  be
    2  applicable,  upon approval by the STATE department OF HEALTH, to recipi-
    3  ents for whom such district is responsible.  Claims for payment shall be
    4  made  in  such  form  and manner as the STATE department OF HEALTH shall
    5  determine.
    6    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
    7  it shall have become a law, provided, however, that effective immediate-
    8  ly, the addition, amendment and/or repeal of any  rules  or  regulations
    9  necessary for the implementation of the foregoing section of this act on
   10  its  effective  date is authorized and directed to be made and completed
   11  on or before such effective date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the social services law, in relation to physician fee reimbursements under the medical assistance for needy persons (medicaid) program
